Package oracle.kubernetes.operator.logging

Class LoggingFacade

java.lang.Object
oracle.kubernetes.operator.logging.LoggingFacade
public class LoggingFacade
extends java.lang.Object
Centralized logging for the operator.

    • convertArraysForLogging

      public static java.lang.Object convertArraysForLogging​(java.lang.Object value, boolean password)
      Converts an array to a loggable string.
      Parameters:
      value - the object to log
      password - true if the value is a password that should not be logged
      Returns:
      a loggable string

      public void config​(java.lang.String msg, java.lang.Object... params)
      Logs a message which requires parameters at the CONFIG level.
      Parameters:
      msg - message to log
      params - vararg list of parameters to use when logging the message

    • config

      public void config​(java.lang.String msg, java.lang.Throwable thrown)
      Logs a message which accompanies a Throwable at the CONFIG level.
      Parameters:
      msg - the message to log
      thrown - an Exception to include in the logged message

    • entering

      public void entering()
      Logs a method entry. The calling class and method names will be inferred.

    • entering

      public void entering​(java.lang.Object... params)
      Logs a method entry, with a list of arguments of interest. The calling class and method names will be inferred. Warning: Depending on the nature of the arguments, it may be required to cast those of type String to Object, to ensure that this variant is called as expected, instead of one of those referenced below.
      Parameters:
      params - varargs list of objects to include in the log message

    • exiting

      public void exiting()
      Logs a method exit. The calling class and method names will be inferred.

    • exiting

      public void exiting​(java.lang.Object result)
      Logs a method exit, with a result object. The calling class and method names will be inferred.
      Parameters:
      result - object to log which is the result of the method call

    • getLevel

      public java.util.logging.Level getLevel()
      Returns the level at which the underlying logger operates.
      Returns:
      a Level object at which logger is operating

    • setLevel

      public void setLevel​(java.util.logging.Level newLevel)
      Sets the level at which the underlying Logger operates. This should not be called in the general case; levels should be set via OOB configuration (a configuration file exposed by the logging implementation, management API, etc).
      Parameters:
      newLevel - Level to set

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the underlying logger.
      Returns:
      a String with the name of the logger

    • getUnderlyingLogger

      public java.util.logging.Logger getUnderlyingLogger()
      Returns the underlying logger. This should only be used when component code calls others' code, and that code requires that we provide it with a Logger.
      Returns:
      the underlying Logger object

      public void info​(java.lang.String msg)
      Logs a message at the INFO level.
      Parameters:
      msg - the message to log

      Parameters:
      msg - the message to log
      params - varargs list of objects to include in the log message

    • info

      public void info​(LoggingFilter loggingFilter, java.lang.String msg, java.lang.Object... params)
      Logs a message which requires parameters at the INFO level with a logging filter applied.
      Parameters:
      loggingFilter - LoggingFilter to be applied, can be null
      msg - the message to log
      params - varargs list of objects to include in the log message

      msg - the message to log
      thrown - an Exception to include in the logged message

      public boolean isConfigEnabled()
      Checks if a message at CONFIG level would actually be logged.
      Returns:
      true if logging at the CONFIG level

      public boolean isLoggable​(java.util.logging.Level level)
      Checks if a message at the provided level would actually be logged.
      Parameters:
      level - a Level object to check against
      Returns:
      true if logging at the level specified

    • log

      public void log​(java.util.logging.Level level, java.lang.String msg)
      Logs a message at the requested level. Normally, one of the level-specific methods should be used instead.
      Parameters:
      level - Level at which log log the message
      msg - the message to log

    • log

      public void log​(java.util.logging.Level level, java.lang.String msg, java.lang.Object... params)
      Logs a message which requires parameters. This replaces the Logger equivalents taking a single param or an Object array, and is backward-compatible with them. Calling the per-Level methods is preferred, but this is present for completeness.
      Parameters:
      level - Level at which log log the message
      msg - the message to log
      params - varargs list of objects to include in the log message
      See Also:
      Logger.log(java.util.logging.Level, String, Object[])

    • log

      public void log​(java.util.logging.Level level, java.lang.String msg, java.lang.Throwable thrown)
      Logs a message which accompanies a Throwable. Calling equivalent per-Level method is preferred, but this is present for completeness.
      Parameters:
      level - Level at which log log the message
      msg - the message to log
      thrown - an Exception to include in the logged message

    • getFormattedMessage

      public java.lang.String getFormattedMessage​(java.lang.String msg, java.lang.Object... args)
      Returns a formatted message.
      Parameters:
      msg - the message to be formatted, which is key to the resource bundle
      args - parameters to the message
      Returns:
      A formatted message
